comments:
Hi, I just installed Eclipse 3.1M5a with no 3rd party plug-ins on an AMD64
running 64-bit with IBM's JDK 1.4.2 and Gtk+ 2.6.2.

I opened a workspace I last used with version 3.0.1 of Eclipse and found out
that the key bindings had changed. I realized that the mapping had switched back
from Emacs to Default, so I selected Emacs again; after this, some keys started
behaving as expected (e.g., keyboard navigation keys as Ctrl+N, Ctrl+P, etc) but
others didn't.

Here, I reset all key combinations with "Restore Defaults." So I had to manually
restore my old configuration. I tried to assign Ctrl+/ to Edit/Undo, but upon
reopening the key binding editor the key combination shows up as unassigned (it
used to be bound to Toggle Comment). If I press it in the Java editor it still
toggles the comment instead of performing what I chose to, and of course this is
doubly incorrect as it's not bound to the Toggle Comment function anymore.

Same thing happened with Ctrl+Y (paste) and Ctrl+W (Emacs: cut, current
behavior: apparently close current editor, even though it's not showed a such).

Anything else of interest I can provide? Eclipse is not outputing anything to
the standard output or error.

There are two separate bugs here.

I cannot reproduce the switching back to Default.  Do you have any additional
plug-ins installed?

The "Ctrl+/" problem should be fixed in I20050301-1230.  Could you try to
reproduce with that integration build, and let me know?

Hi Douglas,

I tried to run that integration build (I got it from
http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/I-Daniela_2-200503011230/index.php)
but I cannot get it to run. It points me to a log file at:
/opt/eclipse-3.1-I20050301-1230/configuration/1109784415922.log. Which contains
the following error message:

What should I do now?

Back to your question, I don't have any plug-ins installed, I just uncompressed
the Eclipse 3.1M5a tarball and used it to run a 3.0.1 workspace. The workspace
referenced a few non-essential plug-ins (SYSDEO's Tomcat, sqlexplorer and
findbugs). I'll try to reproduce it along with the other bug as soon as I'm able
to run one of the integration builds.

I've filed this other bug as Bug 87010.  Until we resolve that, I guess we can't
do much more about this bug.

Can you please try again with next week's integration build, and let me know? 
I20040308-0800 or later....
Thanks Douglas, I'll make it a point to test that build.

It works for me now in I20050308-1510. The keybindings I had set in the 3.0
workspace were all recognized (including the Emacs global setting) and adding a
new key binding for the "Go To Line" action resulted in a working key binding.

Thanks!
I'm not sure when this was fixed -- removing the milestone.
